flow.descriptionCdata:
4fb7ffe7-d0bc-4d38-b4b9-12a373df524a.1ddad014-15be-467a-90cf-3f2e8be47c18.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
4fb7ffe7-d0bc-4d38-b4b9-12a373df524a.8abbde04-8884-4705-9b8b-2d6233a765b3.description=
Runs the Ping command locally. 

Input Parameters\:
    targetHost - The target host to ping
    packetSize - The size of the ping packet
    packetCount - The number of packets to send. 
    timeout - The timeout in miliseconds for the Local Ping operation. Default is 90000.
    ipVersion - IP version forced to the ping command executed on the target host. For Windows -4 or -6 parameters will be added.On Linux will be used ping or ping6. For Solaris -A inet or -A inet6 parameters will be added. For empty string the operation will decide what format to use if targetHost is an ip literal; if targetHost is given as a hostname default 'ping' command will be used on each operating system.
Values\: 4, 6, '' (empty string without quotes).
Default\: '' (empty string without quotes).

Responses\:
    success - The command was executed successfully
    failure - The command could not be executed

Returns\:
    packetsSent - The number of packets sent
    packetsReceived - The number of packets received
    percentagePacketsLost - The percentage of packets lost
    transmissionTimeMin - The minimum time taken for transmitting the packet
    transmissionTimeMax - The maximum time taken for transmitting the packet
    transmissionTimeAvg - The average time taken for transmitting the packet
    returnResult - The raw output of the command
    returnCode - The return code from the executed command
    error - the STDERR of the command
4fb7ffe7-d0bc-4d38-b4b9-12a373df524a.b20fd0b1-9be3-46f2-b623-c002b3ceb8db.description=
Sleeps for the number of seconds specified in the input.

Inputs\:
seconds - The number of seconds to sleep.

Responses\:
success - Slept for the number of seconds given as input.
failure - Was unable to sleep for some reason.
4fb7ffe7-d0bc-4d38-b4b9-12a373df524a.c4729e34-fd0d-41d8-a4c2-06a10b08b0cb.description=
Loops as many number of times as specified in the input, that is, counts from 1 to another number incrementing by 1 for each iteration.

Inputs\:
count - Number of loops to complete.
reset - If true, then the counter will restart counting from 1.

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.

Responses\:
has more 	- Counting has not completed, one or more iterations are pending.
no more 	- Counting completed. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.
failure 	- Something went wrong.
4fb7ffe7-d0bc-4d38-b4b9-12a373df524a.e64765ce-379b-42cf-8eed-48dd0e72b352.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
4fb7ffe7-d0bc-4d38-b4b9-12a373df524a.f7030dca-0fca-4227-9f01-e8a7637b6fc2.description=Reboot the given Server managed in SA. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. agent - Name of the server to reboot now. wait - An integer value specifying How many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the job created.
flow.name: rebootServer

step.name: Wait For Host to be Unpingable
15 Min retry - Give the host time to shutdown and become unpingable
